intro: Ricinocarpos trachyphyllus, commonly known as the rough-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible or medicinal properties. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various desert organisms.
